{"step_by_step_thinking": "Agenesis refers to the complete absence of an organ due to the absence of its primordial tissue. Aplasia refers to the failure of an organ or tissue to develop normally, even though the primordial tissue is present. Atresia refers to the absence or closure of a normal body orifice or tubular organ. Atrophy refers to the decrease in size or wasting away of a body part or tissue. In this case, the question refers to the absence of a precursor cell of an organ leading to the non-development of the organ, which is the definition of Agenesis.", "answer_choice": "A"}
